org.spongepowered.api.effect

Interface Viewer

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    Player, World

    public interface Viewer
    A Viewer is something that sees effects. The Viewer class contains methods for spawning particles and playing sound effects.

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • spawnParticles

        void spawnParticles(Particle particle,
                    int particleCount,
                    Vector3d position,
                    Vector3d offset,
                    double speed)
        Spawn some Particles at a given position. All players within a default radius around the position will see the particles.
        Parameters:
        particle - The particle to create
        particleCount - The number of particle to create
        position - The position at which to create the particle
        offset - The offset to apply to each individual particle
        speed - The speed of the particle, must be at least 0

      • spawnParticles

        void spawnParticles(Particle particle,
                    int particleCount,
                    Vector3d position,
                    Vector3d offset,
                    double speed,
                    int radius)
        Spawn some Particles at a given position. All players within a given radius around the position will see the particles.
        Parameters:
        particle - The particle to create
        particleCount - The number of particle to create
        position - The position at which to create the particle
        offset - The offset to apply to each individual particle
        speed - The speed of the particle, must be at least 0
        radius - The radius around the position where the particles can be seen by players

      • spawnParticles

        void spawnParticles(Particle particle,
                    int particleCount,
                    Vector3d position,
                    Vector3d offset,
                    double speed,
                    ItemType itemType)
        Spawn some Particles at a given position. All players within a default radius around the position will see the particles.

        Some particles like Particles.ITEM_CRACK, Particles.BLOCK_CRACK and Particles.BLOCK_DUST require the item type to render correctly.

        Parameters:
        particle - The particle to create
        particleCount - The number of particle to create
        position - The position at which to create the particle
        offset - The offset to apply to each individual particle
        speed - The speed of the particle, must be at least 0
        itemType - The type of item the particle will base off from

      • spawnParticles

        void spawnParticles(Particle particle,
                    int particleCount,
                    Vector3d position,
                    Vector3d offset,
                    double speed,
                    int radius,
                    ItemType itemType)
        Spawn some Particles at a given position. All players within a given radius around the position will see the particles.

        Some particles like Particles.ITEM_CRACK, Particles.BLOCK_CRACK and Particles.BLOCK_DUST require the item type to render correctly.

        Parameters:
        particle - The particle to create
        particleCount - The number of particle to create
        position - The position at which to create the particle
        offset - The offset to apply to each individual particle
        speed - The speed of the particle, must be at least 0
        radius - The radius around the position where the particles can be seen by players
        itemType - The type of item the particle will base off from

      • playSound

        void playSound(Sound sound,
               Vector3d position,
               double volume)
        Plays the given Sound at the given position. All players within range will hear the sound with the given volume.
        Parameters:
        sound - The sound to play
        position - The position to play the sound
        volume - The volume to play the sound at, usually between 0 and 2

      • playSound

        void playSound(Sound sound,
               Vector3d position,
               double volume,
               double pitch)
        Plays the given Sound at the given position. All players within range will hear the sound with the given volume.
        Parameters:
        sound - The sound to play
        position - The position to play the sound
        volume - The volume to play the sound at, usually between 0 and 2
        pitch - The modulation of the sound to play at, usually between 0 and 2

      • playSound

        void playSound(Sound sound,
               Vector3d position,
               double volume,
               double pitch,
               double minVolume)
        Plays the given Sound at the given position. All players within range will hear the sound with the given volume.
        Parameters:
        sound - The sound to play
        position - The position to play the sound
        volume - The volume to play the sound at, usually between 0 and 2
        pitch - The modulation of the sound to play at, usually between 0 and 2
        minVolume - The minimum volume to play the sound at, usually between 0 and 2
